definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl

sentences.english: The people jumped up and cried.
Was sitting on the floor and cry?
When Chou Chin heard Chin You-yu telling his sad story, he cried even harder.
sentences.chinese: 周进见姊夫说中他的心事，越发号啕大哭。

sentences.english: Devout men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him.
sentences.chinese: 有虔诚的人把司提反埋葬了，为他捶胸大哭。

sentences.english: Then he came back over here, and cried, easily, for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 后来他又返回那儿，放声大哭，足足哭了两个小时。

sentences.english: And then I fled back to my car, sat in the front seat and burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 接着我逃回车上，坐在前面的座位上，放声大哭。

sentences.english: Little Gerda was very frightened, and began to cry;
sentences.chinese: 小小的格尔达非常害怕，开始大哭起来。

sentences.english: My three-year-old ha ba fit when I took his toy away.
sentences.chinese: 当我拿走他的玩具时，我三岁的孩子号啕大哭起来。

sentences.english: Finally , I sit on the ground of nasty cry loudly.
sentences.chinese: 最后急的我，坐在地上哇哇大哭。

sentences.english: She then burst into tears and was totally devestated.
sentences.chinese: 她突然大哭起来，完全失去了控制。

sentences.english: Sid snuffled a bit and Mary went off crying with all her heart.
sentences.chinese: 希德有点抽鼻子，玛丽却是大哭着走的。

sentences.english: The zhen son rush into the palace of earthly tranquility, smell the emperor son crying heartache.
sentences.chinese: 贞儿急往坤宁宫了解，闻得皇儿大哭心痛不已。

sentences.english: Pat will dissolve into tears at least thing, the cry-baby.
sentences.chinese: 帕特为一点点小事就大哭，她是个爱哭精。

sentences.english: I once walked past the young child of a script supervisor, and he burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 有一次我从编剧的小孩面前走过，他立刻放声大哭。

sentences.english: Women cry for five minutes, then do their make-up and it's all over.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往大哭五分钟，然后补装，一切就都结束了。

sentences.english: An old man sees a little boy sitting on a curb, crying.
sentences.chinese: 一位老人看见一个小男孩坐在路旁号啕大哭。

definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
